reviewText: I'm enjoying learning the Tai Chi movements.
Easy to follow. Takes the 24 form movement by movement for beginners plus demo of the bridegroom for those who are more,skilled.

We found the DVD easy to follow and the instructor took time to demonstrate each part of the exercise.  Great for those needing a little extra time to absorb the movements.  Great DVD, would recommend it highly!

If you're serious about learning Tai Chi, then this is the DVD for you!  Dr. Paul Lam teaches in a way that anyone can learn the intricate moves involved.  I've studied Tai Chi for years and this DVD has made my understanding of the stances clear and easy.
Because camera angles hard understand anything other then basic moves.
This video has very clear instruction

Dr Paul Lam's "The 24 Forms" is the best dvd to learn the traditional 24 forms. It's simply the best of its kind. I also have "tai chi for beginners" with Chris Pei but Dr Lam's dvd is much better. No comparison is possible. With Dr Lam's dvd you always have a front & back view at the same time and it's divided into numerous chapters that are easy to navigate so you can find exactly the move you need to review. Very complete. Not a surprise why it's such a big success in sales.
The video was for my mother who at 85 has started learning Tai Chi and wanted to practice on her own as well. She is pleased with the DVD.
Love this  easy to follow, step by-step video.
One of the best I've seen.
first disc was defective but they replaced it promptly and the new one works fine. I would buy from them again!
